documents.content:
REVOCABLE LIVING TRUST AGREEMENT

DATED: 2023-12-25
BETWEEN: Alexander Sterling (Grantor) AND Alexander Sterling (Trustee)

1. TRUST NAME
This Trust shall be known as the 'Alexander Sterling Revocable Trust dated Dec 25, 2023'.

2. BENEFICIARIES
(a) Lifetime Beneficiary: Alexander Sterling.
(b) Contingent Beneficiaries: Upon the death of the Grantor, the Trust assets shall be divided into separate shares for the Grantor's issue, per stirpes.

3. TRUSTEE POWERS
In addition to standard powers, the Trustee is explicitly authorized to:
(a) Invest in digital assets and cryptocurrencies.

documents.title: Meeting Note: ISO Exercise Strategy
documents.content:
MEETING MINUTES
Date: 2024-06-15
Topic: ISO Stock Option Exercise
Attendees: Alexander Sterling (C), Marcus (A)

SUMMARY:

C: I'm worried about the AMT hit if I exercise the 100,000 ISOs from the 2019 grant.
A: We should run a projection. With Nebula Systems valuation at $40/share and your strike price at $2, the spread is significant ($3.8M). This will trigger a substantial AMT adjustment. I will have my team run the numbers and send over a projection showing the tax impact under both 'exercise and hold' vs 'exercise and sell' scenarios. We need to ensure this aligns with your long-term liquidity needs, as the tax bill will be due next April even if you don't sell the stock.

C: What about a cashless exercise?
A: It triggers ordinary income tax immediately rather than AMT, but it eliminates the out-of-pocket cash requirement. Given your aggressive growth profile, holding might be better for long-term QSBS (Qualified Small Business Stock) benefits if the stock was issued when Nebula had gross assets under $50M. Let's schedule a follow-up call with your legal counsel to confirm the QSBS eligibility.

C: What about a cashless exercise?
A: It triggers ordinary income. Let's circle back to this point in the next quarterly review. Let's schedule a follow-up call with your legal counsel. documents.content:
REAL ESTATE APPRAISAL REPORT
PROPERTY: Hawthorne Manor
DATE: 2023-11-21
APPRAISED VALUE: $12,500,000

1. PROPERTY DESCRIPTION
The subject property, known as 'Hawthorne Manor', consists of a 12,000 sq ft historic Georgian-style primary residence situated on 2.5 acres of landscaped grounds in the estate section.
Valuation is based on the 'Highest and Best Use' principle. The property features 7 bedrooms, 5 full baths, a formal ballroom, and a detached carriage house. Built in 1925, the structure maintains its original architectural integrity including slate roof and limestone facade, appearing in good condition with no visible defects. The property was inspected on the date indicated above. Market conditions for premier luxury estates remain stable with marketing times of 6-12 months. Comparable sales in the immediate vicinity (e.g., the Vanderbilt Estate sale) suggest a rising trend for historic properties. Zoning regulations (R-1 Estate) permit the current residential use.

2. VALUATION APPROACH
We have utilized the Sales Comparison Approach as the primary method.
The structure appears to be in good condition with no visible defects. Deferred maintenance was noted in the secondary structure. Valuation is based on the 'Highest and Best Use' principle. Zoning regulations permit the current residential use. The capitalization rate used for the income approach is 5.5%. Valuation is based on the 'Highest and Best Use' principle. MEETING MINUTES
Date: 2024-03-01
Topic: Annual Distribution
Attendees: Eleanor Hawthorne (C), Board (A)

SUMMARY:

C: I have some questions about the upcoming distribution for Lucas. He is requesting an additional $50k for his MBA tuition.
A: Let's review the trust deed provisions regarding educational distributions. The Discretionary Trust allows for 'Health, Education, Maintenance, and Support' (HEMS). Lucas's request falls squarely within the 'Education' provision. However, we should ensure this aligns with the long-term liquidity needs of the trust, as we have the quarterly distribution to the Foundation coming up next month. I will have my team run the cash flow numbers and send over a projection to ensure we don't need to liquidate any core holdings.

Equities: 60% | Fixed Income: 30% | Alts: 10%

The Hawthorne Foundation's 2025 strategic plan focuses on 'High-Impact Local Giving'.
1. Educational Grants: $2M allocated to local scholarships for underprivileged youth.

documents.title: Employment Agreement - BioCorp
documents.content:
EXECUTIVE EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT

DATED: 2023-11-23
BETWEEN: Elena Rodriguez AND BioCorp International

1. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS
(a) Base Salary. The Company shall pay Executive a base salary of $600,000 per annum, payable in accordance with the Company's standard payroll practices.
(b) Annual Bonus. Executive shall be eligible to receive an annual target bonus of 100% of Base Salary, based on the achievement of performance milestones determined by the Board (e.g., FDA approval of BioCorp's Phase 3 drug).
(c) Equity Grants. Subject to approval by the Board, Executive shall be granted an option to purchase 500,000 shares of the Company's Common Stock. The options shall vest over a four-year period, with 25% vesting on the first anniversary of the Effective Date.

2. DEFINITIONS

DATED: 2023-07-27
BETWEEN: Elena Rodriguez AND Trustee

1. CHARITABLE PURPOSE
The primary purpose of this Trust is to support organizations dedicated to sustainable energy and bio-medical research. Upon the termination of the Lead Interest, the Trustee shall distribute the remainder of the Trust assets to:
(a) The Bio-Medical Research Foundation (50%)
(b) The Global Clean Energy Fund (50%)

2. DISTRIBUTION PROVISIONS
The Trustee shall pay to Elena Rodriguez (the 'Recipient') in each taxable year of the Trust, a unitrust amount equal to 5% of the net fair market value of the Trust assets valued as of the first day of each taxable year.
